In FL.


----- Original Message ----
From: Faith Void <littlemsvoid@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, June 6, 2008 3:17:29 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] New to group.


It depends on which state (and maybe even which school district) you
are in. The laws are different or each state, and in my state (PA)
there are descepancies between school districts. What state are you
in?
Faith

On Fri, Jun 6, 2008 at 12:28 PM, ms.tracyv <ms.tracyv@yahoo. com> wrote:
> Hello group. Have 2 sons. 6 and 3. Have tried a few methods. From a
> strict curriculum to practically none used at all. Have a question
> about my child having to be evaluated. How do you find someone that is
> compatible/sympathe tic to this method of homeschooling? I don't want my
> son to be evaluated by a certified teacher that may not "approve" of
> our method of learning. Any advise? Thank you.
>
>

--
www.bearthmama. com

messages.subject: New to group.
messages.msgSnippet: Hello group.  Have 2 sons.  6 and 3.  Have tried a few methods.  From a strict curriculum to practically none used at all.  Have a question about my child
messages.messageBody:
Hello group. Have 2 sons. 6 and 3. Have tried a few methods. From a
strict curriculum to practically none used at all. Have a question
about my child having to be evaluated. How do you find someone that is
compatible/sympathetic to this method of homeschooling? I don't want my
son to be evaluated by a certified teacher that may not "approve" of
our method of learning. Any advise? Thank you.
